techmeme.title: Instagram now requires users to have a public account with 1,000+ followers to go live, aligning with TikTok; previously, the feature was open to all users (Aisha Malik/TechCrunch)
Hoboken, NJ-based Saphyre, which makes software used in securities trading, raised $70M from FTV Capital (Luis Garcia/Wall Street Journal)
Reddit pauses plans to let users make subreddits with content behind a paywall, as it focuses on other priorities, including "accelerating international growth" (Jay Peters/The Verge)
In the UK, X and Reddit are blocking wide-ranging content, including about parliamentary debates, Ukraine, and Gaza, to comply with the Online Safety Act (BBC)
Sources: thousands of US export license applications, including for Nvidia's shipments of AI chips to China, are stalled due to US Commerce Department turmoil (Reuters)
